verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
verses.ct: After 2 full years had passed, Pharaoh had a dream. In it, he was standing beside the Nile River.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
verses.ct: 7 cows came up out of the river — healthy and well-fed — and they grazed in the meadow.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
verses.ct: Then 7 more cows came up out of the river after them, ugly and thin, and they stood next to the other cows on the riverbank.

verses.kjv: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
verses.ct: The ugly, thin cows ate the 7 healthy, fat cows. Then Pharaoh woke up.

verses.kjv: And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
verses.ct: He fell back asleep and had a second dream. In this one, 7 heads of grain grew on a single stalk, plump and ripe.

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
verses.ct: Then 7 more heads of grain sprouted after them — thin and scorched by the east wind.

verses.kjv: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
verses.ct: The 7 thin heads of grain swallowed up the 7 plump, full heads. Pharaoh woke up and realized it had been a dream.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
verses.ct: In the morning, his mind was deeply troubled. He summoned all the magicians and wise men of Egypt. Pharaoh described his dreams to them, but none of them could explain the meaning to him.

verses.kjv: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
verses.ct: Then the chief cupbearer spoke up and said to Pharaoh, "Today I need to confess something I failed to do."

verses.kjv: Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard’s house, both me and the chief baker:
verses.ct: "When you were angry with your servants, you had me and the chief baker locked up in the house of the captain of the guard."

verses.kjv: And we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
verses.ct: "One night, both of us had dreams — each dream with its own meaning."

verses.kjv: And there was there with us a young man, an Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
verses.ct: "A young Hebrew man was there with us, a servant of the captain of the guard. We told him our dreams, and he explained each one to us, giving each dream its own interpretation."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
verses.ct: "Everything turned out exactly as he said it would — I was restored to my position, and the baker was executed by hanging."

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto Pharaoh.
verses.ct: So Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and they rushed him out of the prison. He shaved, changed his clothing, and came before Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
verses.ct: Pharaoh said to Joseph, "I've had a dream that no one can interpret. I've been told that when you hear a dream, you can explain its meaning."

verses.kjv: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
verses.ct: Joseph replied to Pharaoh, "The ability isn't mine — God will give Pharaoh a favorable answer."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river:
verses.ct: So Pharaoh told Joseph, "In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile."

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favoured; and they fed in a meadow:
verses.ct: "7 cows came up from the river — fat and healthy — and they grazed in the meadow."

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favoured and leanfleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
verses.ct: "Then 7 more cows came up after them — scrawny, extremely ugly, and thin. I've never seen such miserable-looking animals anywhere in Egypt."

verses.kjv: And the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
verses.ct: "The thin, ugly cows devoured the first 7 fat cows."

verses.kjv: And when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
verses.ct: "But even after consuming them, you couldn't tell they had eaten anything — they looked just as ugly as before. Then I woke up."

verses.kjv: And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:
verses.ct: "In my next dream, I saw 7 heads of grain growing on a single stalk, full and ripe."

verses.kjv: And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
verses.ct: "Then 7 more heads sprouted after them — shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind."

verses.kjv: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told this unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
verses.ct: "The thin heads swallowed up the 7 good heads. I told all this to the magicians, but none of them could explain it to me."

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: God hath shewed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
verses.ct: Joseph said to Pharaoh, "Both of Pharaoh's dreams carry the same message. God has revealed to Pharaoh what he is about to do."

verses.kjv: The seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
verses.ct: "The 7 healthy cows represent 7 years, and the 7 good heads of grain represent 7 years — it's a single message."

verses.kjv: And the seven thin and ill favoured kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine.
verses.ct: "The 7 thin, ugly cows that came up afterward represent 7 years, and the 7 empty heads of grain scorched by the east wind represent 7 years of famine."

verses.kjv: This is the thing which I have spoken unto Pharaoh: What God is about to do he sheweth unto Pharaoh.
verses.ct: "This is what I was telling Pharaoh: God has shown Pharaoh what he is about to do."

verses.kjv: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:
verses.ct: "7 years of tremendous abundance are coming throughout all of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
verses.ct: "But after them, 7 years of famine will follow. All that abundance will be forgotten in Egypt, and the famine will devastate the land."

verses.kjv: And the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it shall be very grievous.
verses.ct: "The abundance won't even be remembered because the famine that follows will be so severe."

verses.kjv: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
verses.ct: "The reason the dream came to Pharaoh in two forms is that God has firmly decided this, and God will carry it out soon."

verses.kjv: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: "So Pharaoh should find a man with discernment and wisdom and put him in charge of the entire land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
verses.ct: "Pharaoh should also appoint officials throughout the land to collect a 5th of all the produce of Egypt during the 7 years of abundance."

verses.kjv: And let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh, and let them keep food in the cities.
verses.ct: "They should gather all the food from these good years that are coming and store the grain under Pharaoh's authority, keeping the food supply in the cities."

verses.kjv: And that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt; that the land perish not through the famine.
verses.ct: "This stored food will serve as a reserve for the land during the 7 years of famine that will strike Egypt, so the country won't be destroyed by the famine."

verses.kjv: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
verses.ct: This plan seemed excellent to Pharaoh and to all his officials.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto his servants, Can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom the Spirit of God is?
verses.ct: Pharaoh asked his officials, "Where could we find anyone like this — a man who has the Spirit of God in him?"

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath shewed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art:
verses.ct: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, "Since God has revealed all of this to you, there is no one with as much discernment and wisdom as you."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
verses.ct: "You will be in charge of my entire household, and all my people will obey your commands. Only with respect to the throne will I outrank you."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Pharaoh said to Joseph, "I am placing you in authority over the entire land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph’s hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
verses.ct: Pharaoh removed his signet ring from his own hand and placed it on Joseph's hand. He dressed him in fine linen robes and hung a gold chain around his neck.

verses.kjv: And he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him, Bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: He had Joseph ride in his second chariot, and runners went ahead of him shouting, "Make way!" In this way, he made Joseph ruler over the entire land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Pharaoh told Joseph, "I am Pharaoh, but without your permission, no one in all of Egypt will lift a hand or take a step."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On. And Joseph went out over all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Pharaoh gave Joseph the name Zaphnathpaaneah and gave him Asenath as his wife, the daughter of Potipherah, priest of On. Then Joseph traveled throughout the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Joseph was 30 years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh, king of Egypt. After leaving Pharaoh's presence, Joseph traveled across the entire land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
verses.ct: During the 7 years of abundance, the land produced enormous harvests.

verses.kjv: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, laid he up in the same.
verses.ct: Joseph collected all the food produced during those 7 years in Egypt and stored it in the cities. In each city, he stored the grain from the surrounding fields.

verses.kjv: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.
verses.ct: Joseph stockpiled grain in quantities as vast as the sand of the sea — so much that he eventually stopped keeping track, because it was beyond measuring.

verses.kjv: And unto Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came, which Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On bare unto him.
verses.ct: Before the years of famine arrived, Joseph had 2 sons. Asenath, daughter of Potipherah, priest of On, gave birth to them.

verses.kjv: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh: For God, said he, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father’s house.
verses.ct: Joseph named his firstborn Manasseh, saying, "God has made me forget all my hardship and everything about my father's household."

verses.kjv: And the name of the second called he Ephraim: For God hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
verses.ct: He named the second son Ephraim, saying, "God has made me fruitful in the land of my suffering."

verses.kjv: And the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land of Egypt, were ended.
verses.ct: The 7 years of abundance in Egypt came to an end.

verses.kjv: And the seven years of dearth began to come, according as Joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
verses.ct: Then the 7 years of famine began, just as Joseph had predicted. The famine struck every land, but throughout Egypt there was food available.

verses.kjv: And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread: and Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go unto Joseph; what he saith to you, do.
verses.ct: When all of Egypt began to feel the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for food. Pharaoh told all the Egyptians, "Go to Joseph and do whatever he tells you."

verses.kjv: And the famine was over all the face of the earth: And Joseph opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the Egyptians; and the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The famine spread across the entire surface of the earth. Joseph opened all the storehouses and sold grain to the Egyptians, as the famine grew increasingly severe in Egypt.

verses.kjv: And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph for to buy corn; because that the famine was so sore in all lands.
verses.ct: People from every country came to Egypt to buy grain from Joseph, because the famine was devastating throughout the whole world.
